titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Harris et al., Indictment
CWG4453

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
CIRCUIT COURT
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST } Indictment.
William Harris, George Himes, William Fuller, Rice Ruark, Saml Fry, Harrison Ruark

The Grand Jury of Lewis County, in the name, and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William Harris Geo Hines, William Fuller, Rice Ruark, Saml Fry, & Harrison Ruark. of the offence of defacing & injuring unlawfully but not with felonious intent, the house of Geo Rea the real property of said Geo Rea committed as follows: The said Geo. Himes William Fuller Rice Ruark, Saml Fry & Harrison. on the day of October 1863, at the County aforesaid. unlawfully, but not with felonious intention defaced and injured the house of Geo Rea, being the residence of said Rea and his family, situate lying & being on the east fork of Cabin creek in said county of Lewis against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Geo. M. Thomas
Attorney for the Commonwealth
A Copy Test
Tho. W. Mitchel C. L. C. C

THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
AGAINST } Indictment. Injuring Property
William Harris & als
Filed on the 2nd day of Dec 1863
A True Bill.
P. H. C. Bruce
Foreman.
WITNESSES FOR COMMONWEALTH.
Copy. Examined.
